plaster.translation[0].definitions[0].de: a substance used to cover walls and ceilings with a smooth even surface. It consists of lime, water, and sand.
plaster.translation[0].definitions[2].de: a piece of thin material that is stuck on to the skin to cover a small wound
plaster.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to put a wet usually sticky substance all over a surface so that it is thickly covered
plaster.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: Her face was plastered with make-up.
plaster.translation[1].definitions[1].de: to completely cover a surface with something, especially large pieces of paper, pictures etc
plaster.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: The news of the wedding was plastered all over the papers  (=was the main story in the newspapers).
The windows were plastered with notices.
plaster.translation[1].definitions[2].de: to put wet plaster on a wall or ceiling
plaster.translation[1].definitions[3].de: to make your hair lie flat or stick to your head
plaster.translation[1].definitions[3].ex: His hair was plastered to his forehead with sweat.
Her hair had been plastered down by the rain.
plaster.translation[1].note_box[0].items: Plaster is usually passive in meanings 1,2 and 4
